item.title: Mapesbury Rd near junction with Chatsworth Rd, 23rd November
item.description:
Multiple potholes have appeared over last few days, some large and deep enough to be dangerous to cyclists and damaging to vehicles. Urgent action needed.

item.title: Several trip hazards caused by a cable running over pavements and a road, 23rd November
item.description:
The workers have run a thin cable across several paths and a road. It’s not taped down. I almost tripped. I’ve spoken to 2 workers who gave ma a card and said it was only a temporary measure and it wouldn’t be left lie that and they’d look at it “Later”. I told them it wasn’t safe and needed to be corrected now. They didn’t move.

Nearest road to the pin placed on the map (automatically generated by OpenStreetMap): Villiers Road, Penge, Greater London
Report on FixMyStreet
item.category: Utility Works and Temporary Traffic Lights

item.title: Urgent Clean-Up & Maintenance Request – Hawthorne Grove (Rutland House Block), 23rd November
item.description:
I would like to report the following urgent issues on Hawthorne Grove, outside Rutland House Block: • Dog fouling spread across the pavement, worsened as pedestrians walk through it, creating serious hygiene concerns. • Blocked gutter caused by leaves and debris, preventing proper drainage and increasing slip risks. • Overgrown weeds causing additional trip and slip hazards, especially for elderly and vulnerable pedestrians and children. • An awful smell coming from the build-up of waste, raising further hygiene concerns. These conditions are unsafe and unsanitary for pedestrians and residents. Please arrange cleaning, clearing of the gutter, and cutting back of weeds as soon as possible. Thank you.
Nearest road to the pin placed on the map (automatically generated by OpenStreetMap): Hartfield Grove, Anerley, Greater London
Report on FixMyStreet

item.title: Lime bikes blocking public highway, 23rd November
item.description:
The entrance of 22a Hackney Mews (9 residential homes accessed via a gate next to 22 Bouverie Road) is often blocked by Lime Bikes and two are currently blocking safe entry and exit to and from the properties. This is an intermittent problem.

Nearest address to the pin placed on the map (from OS Places API): Bouverie Road, Hackney, London
Report on FixMyStreet

item.title: General waste bin overflowing with recycling, 23rd November
item.description:

item.title: Playground in poor repair, 23rd November
item.description:
We visited the Russell park playground today and it is in sad repair. The web climbing frame and blue frame both had broken hazard tape on them, presumably as they are both unsafe, but it wasn’t clear. The zip wire is broken and missing the seat. The “rocky dog” seat next to the round about was partly snapped off and unsafe. There was very unpleasant graffiti on the “who’s on tv” board which thankfully my son didn’t read. I’m not sure how the playground is periodically reviewed, but it needs attention.
Nearest road to the pin placed on the map (automatically generated by OpenStreetMap): Woolwich Road, Barnehurst, Greater London
Report on FixMyStreet
